content: mouton noir black sheep by melissa clulow our mouton noir hat might just be the easiest coziest winter accessory you will ever knit made with just one skein of gorgeous hand-dyed boucle yarn from julie asselin it s worked straight up in stockinette in-the-round from cast-on to the beginning of crown decreases when the knitting is finished the brim is created by folding the fabric up from the cast-on edge and tacking it in place with four simple stitches at evenly spaced intervals et voilà the softest most comfortable hat you could ask for and stylish to boot yarn julie asselin boucle 70% alpaca 30% highland peruvian wool 240 y 219 m / 100 g 1 skein shown in mouton noir or approximately 190 yds 174 m of a similar worsted weight yarn needles size 4 5 mm us 7 - 16 /40 cm circular needle and dpns - or size needed to obtain gauge notions stitch marker to mark beginning of round tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge 19 sts = 10 cm / 4 in stockinette finished measurements finished circumference 18 5 / 47 cm finished height 9 75 / 25 cm with brim folded up 3 75 / 9 5 cm abbreviations co cast on k knit k2tog knit two stitches together decrease pm place marker sm slip marker ssk slip the next 2 stitches one at a time as if to knit to the right needle insert the left needle into the fronts of these two stitches and knit them together decrease st s stitch es espace tricot | www espacetricot com mouton noir pattern with 16 circular needles co 88 sts place a marker and join for working in the round being careful not to twist the stitches work in stockinette knitting every row until hat measures 11 5 / 29 25 cm from co edge crown shaping switch to dpns when necessary set up row * k22 pm repeat from * 2 more times k22 round 1 * k2tog k18 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times round 2 and all even rnds knit round 3 * k2tog k16 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times round 5 * k2tog k14 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times round 7 * k2tog k12 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times round 9 * k2tog k10 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times round 11 * k2tog k8 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times round 13 * k2tog k6 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times round 15 * k2tog k4 ssk sm repeat from * 3 more times proceed to round 16 without working a plain knit row round 16 * k2tog 3 times sm repeat from * 3 more times finishing cut the yarn and pass through remaining 12 stitches fold brim up 3 5 - 4 / 9 - 10 cm depending on desired amount of slouch and tack with a simple stitch
